Metadata: Carcass proximate composition of juvenile white sturgeon ("Acipenser transmontanus")

Since the first artificial spawning of white sturgeon in 1980, sturgeon have been raised in California with commercial salmonid rations. Body weight gain of the resulting progeny was monitored; however, no carcass composition information was collected until mid-1983. The objective of this study was to determine the carcass proximate composition of cultured white sturgeon and the effects of age on the composition. As a basis for comparison, wild white sturgeon of similar age and a representative cultured fish species, rainbow trout ("Salmon gairdnerii"), reared under similar conditions were analyzed for their proximate compositions.
